summary: Mitchell A. Mars was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in multiple payroll certifications for the committee, specifically for the months of October and November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list his name, position, and salary during these periods. The specific role of Mitchell A. Mars within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Mitchell A. Mars' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the exact nature of his work is not specified in these payroll documents, his presence as a paid staff member suggests he contributed to the committee's research and investigation efforts.
